00012 namespace Sass {
00013   using std::string;
00014   using std::map;
00015   using std::cerr;
00016   using std::endl;
00017 
00018   template <typename T>
00019   class Environment {
00020     // TODO: test with unordered_map
00021     map<string, T> local_frame_;
00022     ADD_PROPERTY(Environment*, parent);
00023 
00024   public:
00025     Memory_Manager<AST_Node> mem;
00026     Environment() : local_frame_(map<string, T>()), parent_(0) { }
00027 
00028     // link parent to create a stack
00029     void link(Environment& env) { parent_ = &env; }
00030     void link(Environment* env) { parent_ = env; }
00031 
00032     // this is used to find the global frame
00033     // which is the second last on the stack
00034     bool is_lexical() const
00035     {
00036       return !! parent_ && parent_->parent_;
00037     }
00038 
00039     // only match the real root scope
00040     // there is still a parent around
00041     // not sure what it is actually use for
00042     // I guess we store functions etc. there
00043     bool is_root_scope() const
00044     {
00045       return parent_ && ! parent_->parent_;
00046     }
00047 
00048     // scope operates on the current frame
00049 
00050     map<string, T>& local_frame() {
00051       return local_frame_;
00052     }
00053 
00054     bool has_local(const string& key) const
00055     { return local_frame_.count(key); }
00056 
00057     T& get_local(const string& key)
00058     { return local_frame_[key]; }
00059 
00060     void set_local(const string& key, T val)
00061     { local_frame_[key] = val; }
00062 
00063     void del_local(const string& key)
00064     { local_frame_.erase(key); }
00065 
00066 
00067     // global operates on the global frame
00068     // which is the second last on the stack
00069 
00070     Environment* global_env()
00071     {
00072       Environment* cur = this;
00073       while (cur->is_lexical()) {
00074         cur = cur->parent_;
00075       }
00076       return cur;
00077     }
00078 
00079     bool has_global(const string& key)
00080     { return global_env()->has(key); }
00081 
00082     T& get_global(const string& key)
00083     { return (*global_env())[key]; }
00084 
00085     void set_global(const string& key, T val)
00086     { global_env()->local_frame_[key] = val; }
00087 
00088     void del_global(const string& key)
00089     { global_env()->local_frame_.erase(key); }
00090 
00091     // see if we have a lexical variable
00092     // move down the stack but stop before we
00093     // reach the global frame (is not included)
00094     bool has_lexical(const string& key) const
00095     {
00096       auto cur = this;
00097       while (cur->is_lexical()) {
00098         if (cur->has_local(key)) return true;
00099         cur = cur->parent_;
00100       }
00101       return false;
00102     }
00103 
00104     // see if we have a lexical we could update
00105     // either update already existing lexical value
00106     // or if flag is set, we create one if no lexical found
00107     void set_lexical(const string& key, T val)
00108     {
00109       auto cur = this;
00110       while (cur->is_lexical()) {
00111         if (cur->has_local(key)) {
00112           cur->set_local(key, val);
00113           return;
00114         }
00115         cur = cur->parent_;
00116       }
00117       set_local(key, val);
00118     }
00119 
00120     // look on the full stack for key
00121     // include all scopes available
00122     bool has(const string& key) const
00123     {
00124       auto cur = this;
00125       while (cur) {
00126         if (cur->has_local(key)) {
00127           return true;
00128         }
00129         cur = cur->parent_;
00130       }
00131       return false;
00132     }
00133 
00134     // use array access for getter and setter functions
00135     T& operator[](const string& key)
00136     {
00137       auto cur = this;
00138       while (cur) {
00139         if (cur->has_local(key)) {
00140           return cur->get_local(key);
00141         }
00142         cur = cur->parent_;
00143       }
00144       return get_local(key);
00145     }
00146 
00147     #ifdef DEBUG
00148     void print()
00149     {
00150       for (typename map<string, T>::iterator i = local_frame_.begin(); i != local_frame_.end(); ++i) {
00151         cerr << i->first << endl;
00152       }
00153       if (parent_) {
00154         cerr << "---" << endl;
00155         parent_->print();
00156       }
00157     }
00158     #endif
00159 
00160   };
00161 }
